page.title: 09BEAUMONT LEYS ESTATE
page.content: Like all built up areas, Beaumont Leys was once open countryside used for agriculture. Unlike other built-up areas however it still retains many remnants of that former countryside. Fields, hedgerows and woods have been retained within the development of housing estates and industrial areas. The open spaces support a great variety of wild plants and animals and allow people immediate access to the country. Beaumont Leys is a major growth point situated to the North West of the City of Leicester covering 1900 acres. The area is a plateau running from the SW to the NE at a height of approx 90 metres above sea level. In the east the land slopes down to the valley of the River Soar.
